content:
How did this get approved, when the Complex For Dwarf test (both the test and validation) fail to follow the Dwarf rules?

In test maze #5 (Warrior wins) the Dwarf is MUCH faster if he can change direction while breaking through a wall.  Since the Warrior wins that one, the Dwarf must be required to continue straight when breaking through a wall.  On top of which, anywhere the Dwarf did this could create multiple paths of identical length, which messes up the solution output.

In the test maze of Complex For Dwarf, the expected solution path (as shown on the Left here) changes direction while breaking a wall TWICE at (15,7) and (13,6).
It also goes through 3 walls in a row at (13,7)-(13,6)-(12,6) which explicitly breaks the "thickness 1" requirement.

In the validation maze of Complex For Dwarf, the expected solution path changes direction within a wall at (7,7) while going through 2 walls in a row (7,7)-(7,6).  If the path went up one more cell before going left it would be correct.
Interesting puzzle. You should have added the tag "dijkstra". The dijkstra avoids to do 4 BFS.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great puzzle to practice pathfinding algorithms. 

The only remark I have is to maybe add a small note to the Elf's path saying that when there is ambiguity between what moves to use to prioritize straight moves as opposed to diagonal moves.
in this case for example:
###
# #
> >
###
the solution should be 
###
# #
>>>
###

and not 
###
#o#
> >
###

even though they have the same cost

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is a great puzzle!  The author has done a wonderful job taking traditional path finding in a maze and adding a twist to make it a truly great opportunity to practice and hone one's skills.

Nice puzzle!  I completed it this morning and I thought it was a nice challenge and a cool variation on the traditional maze path finding.  I see you recently changed the difficulty to hard.  I thought it was a good medium level challenge.

I'd like to make some very minor grammar and formatting edits.  I started writing it all out and I thought I'd just ask you instead.  May I have your permission to do some minor editing?

Example: You capitalized all the bullets in the goal, but you only capitalized one bullet in the Rules.  I'd like to see all bullets capitalized.

Let me know if you are okay with me doing some minor edits.  If not, I'll write everything in another comment.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Thank you for this interesting puzzle.  The statement is clear. There are many tests and validators. I agree with all of them.
I just changed the level to difficult.

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
Great difficulty and challenge, and even better explaination and instructions

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is interesting a a riddle

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
This looks really cool

The rule for MAGE is not clear, I've read "fly straightforward until the next direction change" as the mage has to stop as soon as he can change direction but that's not what he does in (7: complex for mage & 7: complex for mage validator), it should say something like "can fly straightforward as many cells as he want without being able to cross a wall".

In case  2: easy for elf, the last 3 moves can be right, top-right, exit or top-right, right, exit, getting you the same score.

In case 4: easy for dwarf the best score is 30 with mage not 39 with dwarf, you can do:
(0;6) -> (1;6) -> (1;11) -> (9;11) -> (9;6) -> (10;6)

In case 5: complex for warrior validator, the solution with warrior and 
the solution with dwarf both have a score of 168

In case 6: complex for elf, the first 3 moves can be entry, right, right or entry, top-right, bottom-right or entry, bottom-right, top-right, getting you the same score.

In case 6: complex for elf validator the first move that is done is a diagonal move but the solution expect a > (the entry point), that seems like a contradiction, you should either be forced to a right move on entry or change the character in the result.

In case 7: complex for mage validator the best score is 230 not 240.
Your solution does (5;14) -> (7;14) -> (7;13) -> (8;13) -> (8;10) while you can do (5;14) -> (8;14) -> (8;10)

In case 8: complex for dwarf right after the entry you can either do left, up, left, left or left, left, up, left getting you the same score, you also can do the first down at (6:15) or (4;15), there are a total of 24 path with the score 177.

In case 8: complex for dwarf validator , from the start you can do the right after 4 or 6 up and get the same score.

Goal section
* "faster" should be changed to "fastest".
* "straightforward" should be two words instead of one word.
* For the example with MAGE, can't the mage fly straight forward at step 3, so that he can finish the race in 3 x 5 seconds = 15 seconds? Maybe you can add that he needs another 5 seconds to land on the end point?

Input section
* Please format "Line 1:" as <<bold>>.
* Please format "Line 2:" as <<bold>>, and yes, change that to "Line 2" (not "Line 1").
* Please format "Next [[H]] lines:" as <<bold>>.

Output section
* I suggest to rewrite as follows:
<<Line 1:>> The <<champion>> and his <<score>>, separated with a space
<<Next [[H]] lines:>> The complete maze with the path done by the champion. The path is represented using the arrows denoting the directions ({{<}}, {{>}}, {{v}}, {{^}}) except for the elf's diagonal moves which is denoted with {{o}}.

Constraints section
* Please change "best choice" to "champion".
* Please add lower bounds for width and height.
* Please change width and height to [[W]] and [[H]].
* Please change "showing" to "shown" (twice).
* Please move the 5th to 8th constraints to Input section, and place them below "Details of the maze".

Thanks.
Thank you for the review. I corrected my puzzle accrdingly with your comments.

Thank you very much for your time testing my puzzle and pointing out my mistakes. I corrected all the tests accordingly. I hope you can test again your code on it again with success now.

PS : For that remark : "In case 6: complex for elf, the first 3 moves can be entry, right, right or entry, top-right, bottom-right or entry, bottom-right, top-right, getting you the same score." I just add a rule saying : First step and last step are mandatory and can't be changed. So first step for elf can't be a diagonal move.
Thank you very much ! :)
Thank you for your feedback. Have fun playing with my puzzle.

Thank you very much for your feedback.
1) Regarding the difficulty, you are the second person who tell me it should be medium level. I changed it to medium instead of complex.
2) If your minor edits are only dealing with text, formatting that doesn't request changes in tests or code. Then you have my permission to do minor edits. Moreover, I can understand my english can't be better than your english.
3) If you think it is a nice puzzle, could you approve it ?
Thank you very much for playing and thank you for approval. I added your comment.

Hi,
Could you approve again my puzzle?
It has been rejected last month... Now 2 people already validated it so if you could approve it again that would be wonderful. :)

The part " until the next direction change" should be removed since you changed it, also it should be "he wants" not "he want" that's my bad.

For the case  8: complex for dwarf there still are 4 paths with the score 174:
^ < < ^ < < < < < < < v < < < ^ ^ ^ ^ ^ > ^ ^ > > > > > > > > > > ^ > > > ^ ^ ^ < < < ^ < < < < < < < v < < < < <

^ < < ^ < < < < < < < v < < < ^ ^ ^ ^ ^ > ^ ^ > > > > > > > > > > ^ > > > ^ ^ ^ < < ^ < < < < < < < < v < < < < <

^ < ^ < < < < < < < < v < < < ^ ^ ^ ^ ^ > ^ ^ > > > > > > > > > > ^ > > > ^ ^ ^ < < < ^ < < < < < < < v < < < < <

^ < ^ < < < < < < < < v < < < ^ ^ ^ ^ ^ > ^ ^ > > > > > > > > > > ^ > > > ^ ^ ^ < < ^ < < < < < < < < v < < < < <

For all the others cases I found the expected result and only one now.

I  changed again tesst 8: complex for dwarf.
Thank you very much your code is amazing !
Could you please correct a typo I made? In the Output section, "diagonal moves" should be "diagonal move". Sorry for that. Thank you.
